summary: About Season 5
body:
About Season 5

I’d love Eliott to be the main but I think that choice doesn’t go with the essence of Skam which is having different topics in each season and bipolar disorder was already in S3 so for me it must be Arthur.

Arthur is the most free will character for Skam France to do whatever they want without any previous plot issues. Well except for the rushed relationship with Alexia that was weird but it’s easy to resolve.

What I’m trying to say is if we’re going to have a season not based on existing Skam og seasons it must be totally original and in my opinion Arthur is the perfect one.

summary: Attention - chapter 2
title: Attention - chapter 2
body:
Chapter summary: Eliott hadn’t wanted to get his hopes up. But here he was.

Note: Thank you SO SO much for all the comments and the amazing response on the last chapter. It made me want to dive right back into this story as soon as possible. So this is to all of you!

Eliott didn’t really want to get his hopes up. Yes, the next classical music prodigy, or so he’d gathered, had gushed about Eliott’s art on national radio and even admitted to having a crush on him. You know, the usual. But when Eliott reached out to Lucas on Instagram, he honestly hadn’t even expected a reply. At best, he thought it would take Lucas forever to reply, and by then, he probably would have backtracked on his words. Maybe he’d even use some lame excuse about not being in Paris anytime soon, making it impossible to match up their calendars, as a way out of the situation he’d gotten himself into.

But to Eliott’s surprise, Lucas had replied within the hour.

“OMG HI!

I can’t believe you heard that… I am happy that you did, of course! I just didn’t think that you actually would.  

Also, I am in Paris next week. Would you be free for some coffee on Tuesday?

Can’t wait to actually meet you!

Bisous”

Then he expected Lucas to disappear without making any conversation for the next week. That didn’t happen either. Every few days, Lucas would chime in with a “Hey. Hope you’re having a great day. What are you up to?” or a “I feel like I’ve gushed about you enough at this point, so I don’t want to embarrass myself any further in the comments. But that last piece you just posted. *sobs*. Is it something you did recently?”

So yeah, he was getting his hopes up. Hoping this will be the one person who’ll get him. Get his passion for art. Who won’t care that Eliott doesn’t really have any friends. Or care about his fucked up brain.

Still, Eliott kept waiting for the bomb to drop. For Lucas to text him at any point to let him know that he couldn’t make their date. Was it even a date? Or even worse, that he’d changed his mind and didn’t want to see or talk to Eliott again. When Tuesday came around though, neither of those things had happened.

—

That morning, Eliott woke up at 8 am. Him and Lucas had decided to meet up at noon, so Eliott had hoped for a bit of a lie-in. However, when finding himself unable to fall back asleep, Eliott leaned over the edge of his bed and grabbed the sketchbook that had been tossed on the floor the night before. He fluffed the pillows, sat with his back up against the wall and started sketching. A few hours later, he got up.

While enjoying his morning cup of coffee on the couch, Eliott inspects his sketches. He crosses out a few of them immediately. They hadn’t turned out the way he wanted them to. But one of them, he circles. It has potential.

After grabbing a quick shower, he sits back down to clean up his drawing. Crossing his legs, he opens the Procreate app on his iPad and starts by outlining the hour glass with a thin black brush. He makes the lines uneven and a bit shaky on purpose. He then chooses a pencil-like brush to draw the sand passing from the top of the hour glass to the bottom, before going back to the original black brush to draw his signature racoon lying on top of the hour glass.

It wasn’t his best piece, or the most subtle one. But it was a clear representation of his current state of mind. Rough around the edges from past experiences, glass like and transparent. A bystander, waiting for something meaningful to happen. Something worthwhile.

Or maybe he was simply waiting for the next hour or so to pass until he got to see Lucas. Lucas with his ridiculously blue and expressive eyes. The most beautiful nose and spikiest and most unruly hair he’d ever seen. Yeah, he had looked through Lucas’ Instagram quite a lot over the past week, okay. Lucas even seemed truly comfortable in his own skin and his own sexuality, speaking so openly about it on national radio. Eliott was neither of those two things.

Although he knew he was pansexual, Eliott had never really come out. His parents more or less knew he wasn’t straight. But he had never brought a partner home, and so he hadn’t felt the need to explain his sexuality to them. And besides his parents, he didn’t really have anyone else to come out to.

After a few final touches, Eliott is as happy with the drawing as he’ll ever be. Which is accidentally also when he notices the clock on his iPad.

Once happy with the drawing, Elliot notices the clock on his iPad. It’s still a bit early, but he decides to get ready anyway. He reasons that he can always just walk to where he’s meeting Lucas instead of taking the metro. Before getting up, Eliott posts his drawing on Instagram. He decides against writing a caption for it, leaving the interpretation up to the viewer.

While it processes, he puts his shoes on and goes to the mirror for one final check before leaving. While grabbing his keys from the little bowl on the shelf below the mirror, his phone pings with a notification from Instagram. It’s Lucas. He’s liked the photo already. How is that even possible? Does Lucas have notifications on his profile turned on!?

Shaking his head in disbelief for what feels like the 100th time in just under a week, Eliott heads out, ready to meet the (in)famous Lucas Lallemant.

A3O link

He then chooses a pencil-like brush to draw the sand passing from the top of the hour glass to the bottom, before going back to the original black brush to draw his signature racoon lying on top of the hour glass.

It wasn’t his best piece, or the most subtle one. But it was a clear representation of his current state of mind. Rough around the edges from past experiences, glass like and transparent. A bystander, waiting for something meaningful to happen. Something worthwhile.

Or maybe he was simply waiting for the next hour or so to pass until he got to see Lucas. Lucas with his ridiculously blue and expressive eyes. The most beautiful nose and spikiest and most unruly hair he’d ever seen. Yeah, he had looked through Lucas’ Instagram quite a lot over the past week, okay. Lucas even seemed truly comfortable in his own skin and his own sexuality, speaking so openly about it on national radio. Eliott was neither of those two things.

Although he knew he was pansexual, Eliott had never really come out. His parents more or less knew he wasn’t straight. But he had never brought a partner home, and so he hadn’t felt the need to explain his sexuality to them. And besides his parents, he didn’t really have anyone else to come out to.

After a few final touches, Eliott is as happy with the drawing as he’ll ever be. Which is accidentally also when he notices the clock on his iPad.

Once happy with the drawing, Elliot notices the clock on his iPad. It’s still a bit early, but he decides to get ready anyway. He reasons that he can always just walk to where he’s meeting Lucas instead of taking the metro. Before getting up, Eliott posts his drawing on Instagram. He decides against writing a caption for it, leaving the interpretation up to the viewer.

While it processes, he puts his shoes on and goes to the mirror for one final check before leaving. While grabbing his keys from the little bowl on the shelf below the mirror, his phone pings with a notification from Instagram. It’s Lucas. He’s liked the photo already. How is that even possible? Does Lucas have notifications on his profile turned on!?

Shaking his head in disbelief for what feels like the 100th time in just under a week, Eliott heads out, ready to meet the (in)famous Lucas Lallemant.

A3O link
trail.content_abstract:
Chapter summary: Eliott hadn’t wanted to get his hopes up. But here he was.

Note: Thank you SO SO much for all the comments and the amazing response on the last chapter. It made me want to dive right back into this story as soon as possible. So this is to all of you!

Eliott didn’t really want to get his hopes up. Yes, the next classical music prodigy, or so he’d gathered, had gushed about Eliott’s art on national radio and even admitted to having a crush on him. You know, the usual. But when Eliott reached out to Lucas on Instagram, he honestly hadn’t even expected a reply. At best, he thought it would take Lucas forever to reply, and by then, he probably would have backtracked on his words. Maybe he’d even use some lame excuse about not being in Paris anytime soon, making it impossible to match up their calendars, as a way out of the situation he’d gotten himself into.

But to Eliott’s surprise, Lucas had replied within the hour.

tags: i don't know what this is...a headcanon more than anything
summary: At one point during the night, Lucas catches Eliott in the corner with Idriss. He can’t hear what they’re saying but he can tell...
body:
At one point during the night, Lucas catches Eliott in the corner with Idriss. He can’t hear what they’re saying but he can tell how happy Eliott is based off his body language and the way his entire face lights up when he smiles. He had been gently trying to push Eliott to reach out to Idriss the past couple of days, telling him that Idriss didn’t know he was bipolar, that maybe Idriss misses him as much as Eliott misses Idriss. But Eliott would shrug it off and change the subject. 

It pained Lucas that Eliott thought his best friend rejected him.

He knew how that felt.

He hung back a bit, letting the two of them spend the time together. He couldn’t help smiling at the way Idriss leaned down to say something in Eliott’s ear, Eliott’s head falling back as he burst out laughing. This was a great look on Eliott. He didn’t want to interrupt it.

“Thick as thieves those two were,” he hears Imane say behind him. 

“Oh yeah?” Lucas nodded back to the pair. “They always been close?”

Imane laughed. “Those two have been friends since they were maybe seven years old. You know, Idriss would pick on me all the time but Eliott would always jump in to defend my honor.”

She smiled and looked at Lucas. “Eliott was always my favorite of Idriss’ friends.” A beat. “After Sofiane, of course.”

Lucas looked back at the two, Eliott finally noticing him and catching his eye. Eliott smiled at him. That big beautiful smile that could light a room. A smile that was his and his only.

“I’m glad Eliott has Idriss again,” he says, still smiling at Eliott.

“And I’m glad Idriss has Eliott again. He missed him. I know it.” Imane gently laid a hand on Lucas’ shoulder before walking back into the crowd.

“And I’m glad I have him,” he says to himself, finally pushing himself off the wall to walk towards Eliott and Idriss. 

Things were going to be okay now.

summary: Listen I have not given up hope for more seasons so here’s my not so sappy goodbye post: Skam France Season 3 remains my...
body:
Listen I have not given up hope for more seasons so here’s my not so sappy goodbye post:

Skam France Season 3 remains my favorite season in the Skam Universe. It’s over 2 months later and I can’t stop rewatching it. Lucas and Eliott are in the top of my absolute favorite fictional characters individually, and they’re literally my favorite fictional couple period. The racoon, the hedgehog and the Polaris-symbolism will always stay with me. No season of any Skam, OG included, ever hit me like this one did. I’m not gonna shut up about this season anytime soon and I hope most of y’all won’t either. 

Season 4 had a great main character, and she deserved a way better season than she got. I really wanted to love it but I didn’t. It’s such a shame, because we saw in Season 3 that they can do much much better than this, which is why I can’t accept them leaving us with this season.

@Skam France put us out of our misery and annouce Season 5 and 6 already
